page.title: 19HULL SCHOOLS' REORGANISATION
page.content: The Hull division of the Humberside Education Authority has been given approval by the Secretary of State to reorganise the school system within the city. A fall in the birth rate during the last two decades has meant that the city's senior high schools have too few children. The present system involves children attending primary school from the age of five to the age of nine, middle school from nine to thirteen and senior high school from thirteen to sixteen, with an option to continue in the Sixth Forms up to the age of eighteen. The new system will abolish middle schools, creating a three tier system - five to eleven, eleven to sixteen and new Sixth form Colleges.
